TopicTitle: Import V1.0.5 Fairing into V1.2 = Kraken?

Articles.Content:
Well, THAT was ... interesting....

(Not sure if this should go in Gameplay Questions, or General Discussion, or Support, or something else.  Mods, feel free to move this if someplace else is more appropriate.)

(Disclaimer: I skipped the entire Version 1.1.x series entirely, so I don't know if I've run afoul of a 1.0 -> 1.1 change or a 1.1 -> 1.2 change.  I also don't know if it really is associated with fairings, as I was more interested in making the craft WORK than in determining exactly where the problem was.)

I had an existing V1.0.x craft that was well-suited to pulling off a string of.. 6, I think? ... contracts in my new V1.2 career save.  I'd used it across multiple versions of 1.0.x and it has always been rock-solid.  So I copied the .craft file, tweaked it a bit for my current relatively-early tech level, and hit "launch"... mildly concerned about how the ungainly, poorly-streamlined beast would handle the new drag tweaks in V1.2.  Turned out I was concerned about the wrong thing completely.

It seemed to fly reasonably well at subsonic speeds (perhaps a bit less stable than I remembered, but nothing I couldn't handle...and that's likely because I was controlling it via an Octo rather than a later-tech probe core with "follow prograde" capability).  Then at somewhere in the low-transonic regime (200-250 m/s-ish) it exploded with zero warning.  Like, "all is fine" to "OMG what was THAT" in a single frame--just a FLASH afterimage of an explosion, and the camera focused on a lonely crew pod spinning at many revolutions per second with a cloud of debris around it.  Then I noticed that the sky was turning black and Kerbin turning into a sphere WAY TOO FAST and then the Mun was behind me and I was coming up on Minmus orbit radius and OMG THIS IS INTERPLANETARY SPACE...and only when I had gone interplanetary (less than 2 minutes from launch) did my indicated velocity change from the 200-300 m/sec range.  Hit "Revert to Launch" to see if it was repeatable, and discovered that:

1) KSC was sideways, with the sky to the left and the ground to the right (I can only assume that North was at the top of the screen...?)

2) The staging display was borked, with every stageable part dumped into a single stage,

3) None of the camera or vehicle controls were functional.  I had to Ctrl-Alt-Del my way out of KSP.

I've tried a few times since, and the behavior was pretty repeatable with some minor variations (sometimes the velocity indication goes to a huge number; sometimes I can successfully "revert to VAB", sometimes a larger fraction of the upper stage survives the explosion, sometimes the boost stage survives intact and even appears to remain stable...)

I am currently blaming the imported fairing, because I know fairings have had a substantial redesign since the 1.0.x timeframe, and because while the boost stage sometimes survives mostly-intact and sometimes the payload survives mostly-intact, the fairing always appears to detach from all other parts.

So, is there a known problem with importing fairings (or other parts) from older versions?  Have other people seen this sort of behavior?  And, of course, the most important question of all:  has anyone figured out a way to CONTROL this effect and turn it into a useful Kraken Drive? 

I should probably note:  The craft DESIGN, per se, still works okay in V1.2.  I rebuilt it from scratch (well, mostly; I made a few minor tweaks to remove compromises necessary back in V1.0.2 and which I'd just never removed from the design) and it launched just fine.  So this does appear to be related to the import from V1.0.x.
